page.title: 08PLESIOSAURUS
page.content: The Plesiosaurus monument is built of stone on a roundabout. On it is a big sign saying BARROW UPON SOAR. Below the writing is the Plesiosaurus, a dinosaur found in Barrow Limestone.The roundabout is at the junction of three roads, Bridge Street, High Street and Sileby Road. The monument was put up in Commemoration of the Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. The roundabout is called "Jerusalem". It was built in 1953. The skeleton's remains are kept in Leicester Museum. The Plesiosaurus has a nickname. It is the "Red Herring". It was given this nickname because before it was built there was an old house on the site chosen for the monument, and the people of Barrow thought the house was worth more than a monument to the dinosaur. {ANDREA FAIREY {HAYLEY SYKES
